    "en": "Sea Ice Index",
    "es": "Índice de hielo marino"
  },
  "description": "This is an example dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1"
}
                                                                                                  Property: description
                                                                                                  Property description
                                                                                                  Requirement level Mandatory
                                                                                                  Cardinality 1..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:description
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Literal
                                                                                                  Definition This property contains a free-text account of the Dataset.
                                                                                                  Usage note This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the description (see Multilingualism). On the user interface of data portals, the content of the element whose language corresponds to the display language selected by the user is displayed.
                                                                                                  Example 38: Usage of dcterms:description for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .


<https://census.gov/datasets/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;

  # mandatory property 
  dcterms:description "Some description in english",  # english description (default)
  "Alguna descripción en español"@es . # spanish description
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/datasets/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "publisher": "https://census.gov",
  "description": "Some description in english",
  "descriptionMap": {
    "es": "Alguna descripción en español"
  }
}

                                                                                                  5.16.2 Recommended Properties

                                                                                                  Property: contact point
                                                                                                  Property contact point
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:contactPoint
                                                                                                  Range vcard:Kind
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property contains contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.
                                                                                                  • This property MUST contain an email address that is continuously monitored by the data publisher.
                                                                                                  • If there are several contributors involved in the publication of the Dataset, the property can be used multiple times.
                                                                                                  Example 39: Usage of dcat:contactPoint for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix vcard: <http://www.w3.org/2006/vcard/ns#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://census.gov/datasets/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;
  dcat:contactPoint [
    a vcard:Kind ;
    vcard:fn "US Census Info" ;
    vcard:hasEmail <mailto:info@census.gov>
  ] .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/datasets/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "description": "This dataset contains information about...",
  "publisher": "https://census.gov",
  "contactPoint": {
    "@type": "vcard:Kind",
    "fn": "US Census Info",
    "hasEmail": "mailto:info@census.gov"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: dataset distribution
                                                                                                  Note
                                                                                                  Changes from DCAT-US 1.1: In transitioning from the DCAT-US 1.1 to the DCAT-US 3.0 Profile, the requirement level of dcat:distribution has been changed from mandatory to recommended, to offer greater flexibility to federal agencies, recognizing the varied nature of datasets, their stages, and potential sensitivity. This change aimed to reduce barriers to dataset listings and adapt to the evolving data-sharing landscape within federal entities.
                                                                                                  Property dataset distribution
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  URI dcat:distribution
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Distribution
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property links the Dataset to an available Distribution.
                                                                                                  • In exceptional cases, a Dataset for which no distribution form exists (yet) can be described in the Catalog. In this case, the element dcat:distribution may be omitted.
                                                                                                  Example 40: Usage of dcat:distribution for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://census.gov/datasets/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;
  dcat:distribution <https://census.gov/resource/456> ,
                    <https://census.gov/resource/345> .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/datasets/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "description": "This dataset contains information about...",
  "publisher": "https://census.gov",
  "distribution": [
    "https://census.gov/resource/456",
    "https://census.gov/resource/345"
  ]
}
                                                                                                  Property: identifier
                                                                                                  Property identifier
                                                                                                  Requirement level Mandatory
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:identifier
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Literal
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property contains a unique identifier for the Dataset, e.g. a URI or other unique identifier in the context of the Catalog.
                                                                                                  Example 41: Usage of dcterms:identifier for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:identifier "10.7265/N5K072F8" .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "identifier": "10.7265/N5K072F8"
}
                                                                                                  Property: spatial/geographic coverage
                                                                                                  Property spatial/geographic coverage
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:spatial
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:Location
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to a geographic region that is covered by the Dataset.
                                                                                                  • CV to be used: The Vocabularies Name Authority Lists MUST be used for continents, countries and places that are in those lists; if a particular location is not in one of the mentioned Named Authority Lists, Geonames URIs MUST be used: [DATA-GOV-CONT], [DATA-GOV-COUNTRY], [DATA-GOV-PLACE], [GEONAMES]
                                                                                                  Example 42: Usage of dcterms:spatial for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix locn: <http://www.w3.org/ns/locn#> .
@prefix gsp: <http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .

<https://example.com/ns/Dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:spatial [
    a dcterms:Location ;
    locn:geometry """POLYGON ((
          4.8842353 52.375108 , 4.884276 52.375153 ,
          4.8842567 52.375159 , 4.883981 52.375254 ,
          4.8838502 52.375109 , 4.883819 52.375075 ,
          4.8841037 52.374979 , 4.884143 52.374965 ,
          4.8842069 52.375035 , 4.884263 52.375016 ,
          4.8843200 52.374996 , 4.884255 52.374926 ,
          4.8843289 52.374901 , 4.884451 52.375034 ,
          4.8842353 52.375108
        ))"""^^gsp:wktLiteral
  ], [
    a dcterms:Location ;
    dcat:centroid "POINT(4.88412 52.37509)"^^gsp:wktLiteral
  ], [
    a dcterms:Location ;
    dcat:bbox """POLYGON((
          3.053 47.975 , 7.24  47.975 ,
          7.24  53.504 , 3.053 53.504 ,
          3.053 47.975
        ))"""^^gsp:wktLiteral
  ], <https://www.geonames.org/2658434> .

<https://www.geonames.org/2658434> a dcterms:Location;
    skos:prefLabel "Switzerland".
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/ns/Dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "spatial": [
    {
      "@type": "dcterms:Location",
      "geometry": {
        "@type": "gsp:wktLiteral",
        "@value": "POLYGON ((4.8842353 52.375108 , 4.884276 52.375153 , 4.8842567 52.375159 , 4.883981 52.375254 , 4.8838502 52.375109 , 4.883819 52.375075 , 4.8841037 52.374979 , 4.884143 52.374965 , 4.8842069 52.375035 , 4.884263 52.375016 ,4.8843200 52.374996 , 4.884255 52.374926 , 4.8843289 52.374901 , 4.884451 52.375034 , 4.8842353 52.375108))"
      }
    },
    {
      "@type": "dcterms:Location",
      "centroid": {
        "@type": "gsp:wktLiteral",
        "@value": "POINT(4.88412 52.37509)"
      }
    },
    {
      "@type": "dcterms:Location",
      "bbox": {
        "@type": "gsp:wktLiteral",
        "@value": "POLYGON((3.053 47.975 , 7.24  47.975 ,7.24  53.504 , 3.053 53.504 , 3.053 47.975))"
      }
    },
    {
      "@id": "https://www.geonames.org/2658434",
      "@type": "dcterms:Location",
      "prefLabel": "Switzerland"
    }
  ]
}
                                                                                                  Property: keyword/tag
                                                                                                  Property keyword/tag
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:keyword
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Literal
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property contains a keyword or tag describing the Dataset.
                                                                                                  • Good practice: mark the language of the keywords with the [ISO 639-1] language code such as "geodata"@en.
                                                                                                  Example 43: Usage of dcat:keyword for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  # Recommended property

  dcat:keyword "Sea Ice"@en,
               "Sea Ice Anomalies"@en,
               "Sea Ice Concentration"@en,
               "Sea Ice Conditions"@en,
               "Sea Ice Extent"@en .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "keywordMap": {
    "en": [
      "Sea Ice",
      "Sea Ice Anomalies",
      "Sea Ice Concentration",
      "Sea Ice Conditions",
      "Sea Ice Extent"
    ]
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: landing page
                                                                                                  Property landing page
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:landingPage
                                                                                                  Range foaf:Document
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to a web page that provides access to the Dataset, its Distributions and/or additional information.
                                                                                                  • It is intended to point to a landing page at the original data provider, not to a page on a site of a third party, such as an aggregator.
                                                                                                  Example 44: Example of dcat:landingPage for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcat:landingPage <https://example.gov/dataset1/about> . # landing page of the dataset
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "landingPage": "https://example.gov/dataset1/about"
}
                                                                                                  Property: update/modification date
                                                                                                  Property update/modification date
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:modified
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Literal (typed as xsd:date, xsd:dateTime, xsd:gYear or xsd:gYearMonth)
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property contains the most recent date on which the Dataset was changed or modified.
                                                                                                  • No value may indicate that the Dataset has never changed after its initial publication, or that the date of the last modification is not known, or that the Dataset is continuously updated
                                                                                                  • This property MUST only be set if the distributions (the actual data) that the Dataset describes have been updated after it has been issued. In this case the property MUST contain the date of the last update. That way a person or institution using the data for an analysis or application will know when to update the report or application on their side.
                                                                                                  Example 45: Usage of dcterms:modified for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:modified "2021-04-26"^^xsd:date .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://opendata.zurich/opendata/data/1234",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "modified": {
    "@type": "xsd:date",
    "@value": "2021-04-26"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: publisher
                                                                                                  Property publisher
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:publisher
                                                                                                  Range foaf:Agent
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to an entity (organization) responsible for making the Dataset available.
                                                                                                  Example 46: Usage of dcterms:publisher for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix org: <http://www.w3.org/ns/org#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .

<https://census.gov/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> .

<https://census.gov>
  a org:Organization ;
  foaf:name "Federal Office of Topography";
  skos:prefLabel "Federal Office of Topography";
  .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "description": "This dataset contains information about...",
  "publisher": {
    "@id": "https://census.gov",
    "@type": "http://www.w3.org/ns/org#Organization",
    "name": "Federal Office of Topography",
    "prefLabel": "Federal Office of Topography"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: geographic bounding box
                                                                                                  Property geographic bounding box
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat-us:geographicBoundingBox
                                                                                                  Range dcat-us:GeographicBoundingBox
                                                                                                  Definition A geographic bounding box in WGS 84 coordinate systems (Lat/Long) that describes the spatial extent of the dataset.
                                                                                                  Usage A dataset can have multiple geographic bounding boxes (example continental US and Alaska). The goal of having geographic bounding box is to provide a common coordinate reference system to describe the spatial extent of the dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 47: Example for dcat:geographicBoundingBox for dcat:Dataset. 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcat-us: <http://resources.data.gov/ontology/dcat-us#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix locn: <http://www.w3.org/ns/locn#> .
@prefix gsp: <http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcat-us:geographicBoundingBox [
      a dcat-us:GeographicBoundingBox ;
      dcat-us:westBoundingLongitude 22.3;
      dcat-us:eastBoundingLongitude 10.3;
      dcat-us:northBoundingLatitude 50.2;
      dcat-us:southBoundingLatitude 20.2;
  ]
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher":"https://example.com/publisher1",
  "geographicBoundingBox": {
    "@type": "dcat-us:GeographicBoundingBox",
    "eastBoundingLongitude": "10.3",
    "northBoundingLatitude": "50.2",
    "southBoundingLatitude": "20.2",
    "westBoundingLongitude": "22.3"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: temporal coverage
                                                                                                  Property temporal coverage
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:temporal
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:PeriodOfTime
                                                                                                  Usage note The temporal coverage of a dataset may be encoded as an instance of dcterms:PeriodOfTime, or may be indicated using an IRI reference (link) to a resource describing a time period.
                                                                                                  Example 48: Usage of dcterms:temporal for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
@prefix ex: <http://www.example.com#> .

ex:budget2018 a dcat:Dataset;  
	dcterms:title "Budget for 2018";
	dcterms:description "This dataset contains the budget for 2018";
	dcterms:publisher <https://treasury.gov>;
	dcterms:temporal [ 
		a dcterms:PeriodOfTime ;
		dcat:startDate "2018-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
		dcat:endDate   "2018-12-31"^^xsd:date ;
	] .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "http://www.example.com#budget2018",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Budget for 2018",
  "description": "This dataset contains the budget for 2018",
  "publisher": "https://treasury.gov",
  "temporal": {
    "@type": "dcterms:PeriodOfTime",
    "startDate": {
      "@value": "2018-01-01",
      "@type": "xsd:date"
    },
    "endDate": {
      "@value": "2018-12-31",
      "@type": "xsd:date"
    }
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: theme/category
                                                                                                  Property theme/category
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:theme
                                                                                                  Range skos:Concept
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to a category of the Dataset. A Dataset may be associated with multiple themes.
                                                                                                  • CV to be used: [DATA-GOV-THEME]
                                                                                                  Example 49: Example for dcat:theme for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .

<https://doi.org/10.7265/N5K072F8>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Sea Ice Index"; 
  dcterms:description "This is an example dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcat:theme <https://example.com/themes/ClimateChange> . # Theme from a well-defined taxonomy

<https://example.com/themes/ClimateChange>
  a skos:Concept ;
  skos:prefLabel "Climate Change"@en ;
  skos:inScheme <https://example.com/themes/scheme> .

# Scheme definition for completeness
<https://example.com/themes/scheme>
  a skos:ConceptScheme ;
  dcterms:title "A Theme Taxonomy"@en .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://doi.org/10.7265/N5K072F8",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Sea Ice Index",
  "description": "This is an example dataset",
  "publisher": {
    "@id": "https://example.com/publisher1"
  },
  "theme": {
    "@id": "https://example.com/themes/ClimateChange",
    "@type": "skos:Concept",
    "prefLabel": "Climate Change",
    "inScheme": {
      "@id": "https://example.com/themes/scheme",
      "@type": "skos:ConceptScheme",
      "title": "A Theme Taxonomy"
    }
  }
}

                                                                                                  5.16.3 Optional Properties

                                                                                                  Property: access rights
                                                                                                  Property access rights
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:accessRights
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:RightsStatement
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to information that indicates whether the Dataset is open data, has access restrictions or is not public.
                                                                                                  • CV to be used: [DATA-GOV-AR].
                                                                                                  Property: conforms to
                                                                                                  Property conforms to
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:conformsTo
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:Standard
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to an implementing rule or other specification.
                                                                                                  • This property SHOULD be used to indicate the model, schema, ontology, view or profile that this representation of a Dataset conforms to. This is (generally) a complementary concern to the media-type or format.
                                                                                                  Example 50: Usage of dcterms:conformsTo for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .


<https://census.gov/datasets/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;
  dcterms:conformsTo <http://resource.geosciml.org/ontology/timescale/gts> ;
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/datasets/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "description": "This dataset contains information about...",
  "publisher": "https://census.gov",
  "conformsTo": "http://resource.geosciml.org/ontology/timescale/gts"
}
                                                                                                  Property: contributor
                                                                                                  Property contributor
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:contributor
                                                                                                  Range foaf:Agent
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to an agent contributing to the Dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 51: Usage of dcterms:contributor for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .


<https://census.gov/datasets/123>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;
  # contributor of the resource          
  dcterms:contributor <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0693-466X> .


<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0693-466X> a foaf:Person;
  foaf:name "John Doe" ;
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/datasets/123",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 123",
  "description": "This dataset contains information about...",
  "publisher": "https://census.gov",
  "contributor": {
    "@id": "https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0693-466X",
    "@type": "foaf:Person",
    "name": "John Doe"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: creator
                                                                                                  Property creator
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:creator
                                                                                                  Range foaf:Agent
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to an entity responsible for producing the dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 52: Usage of dcterms:creator for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 123" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset contains information about..." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://census.gov> ;
  # creator of the resource          
  dcterms:creator <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0693-466X>.


<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0693-466X> a foaf:Person;
  foaf:name "John Doe" ;

  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",

                                                                                                  Property: data dictionary
                                                                                                  Property data dictionary
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcat-us:describedBy
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Distribution
                                                                                                  Usage note

                                                                                                  This is used to specify a data dictionary or schema that defines fields (variables, dimensions, measures, attributes) in the dataset.
                                                                                                  Property: documentation
                                                                                                  Property documentation
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI foaf:page
                                                                                                  Range foaf:Document
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to a page or document about this Dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 53: Usage of foaf:page for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  <!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
    <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'none'; style-src 'unsafe-inline'; img-src data:; connect-src 'self'">
    <title>Page not found &middot; GitHub Pages</title>
    <style type="text/css" media="screen">
      body {
        background-color: #f1f1f1;
        margin: 0;
        font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
      }

      .container { margin: 50px auto 40px auto; width: 600px; text-align: center; }

      a { color: #4183c4; text-decoration: none; }
      a:hover { text-decoration: underline; }

      h1 { width: 800px; position:relative; left: -100px; letter-spacing: -1px; line-height: 60px; font-size: 60px; font-weight: 100; margin: 0px 0 50px 0; text-shadow: 0 1px 0 #fff; }
      p { color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); margin: 20px 0; line-height: 1.6; }

      ul { list-style: none; margin: 25px 0; padding: 0; }
      li { display: table-cell; font-weight: bold; width: 1%; }

      .logo { display: inline-block; margin-top: 35px; }
      .logo-img-2x { display: none; }
      @media
      only screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
      only screen and (   min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
      only screen and (     -o-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2/1),
      only screen and (        min-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
      only screen and (                min-resolution: 192dpi),
      only screen and (                min-resolution: 2dppx) {
        .logo-img-1x { display: none; }
        .logo-img-2x { display: inline-block; }
      }

      #suggestions {
        margin-top: 35px;
        color: #ccc;
      }
      #suggestions a {
        color: #666666;
        font-weight: 200;
        font-size: 14px;
        margin: 0 10px;
      }

    </style>
  </head>
  <body>

    <div class="container">

      <h1>404</h1>
      <p><strong>File not found</strong></p>

      <p>
        The site configured at this address does not
        contain the requested file.
      </p>

      <p>
        If this is your site, make sure that the filename case matches the URL
        as well as any file permissions.<br>
        For root URLs (like <code>http://example.com/</code>) you must provide an
        <code>index.html</code> file.
      </p>

      <p>
        <a href="https://help.github.com/pages/">Read the full documentation</a>
        for more information about using <strong>GitHub Pages</strong>.
      </p>

      <div id="suggestions">
        <a href="https://githubstatus.com">GitHub Status</a> &mdash;
        <a href="https://twitter.com/githubstatus">@githubstatus</a>
      </div>

  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "page": {
    "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1/about",
    "@type": "foaf:Document",
    "title": "About this dataset"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: frequency
                                                                                                  Property frequency
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:accrualPeriodicity
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:Frequency
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to the frequency at which the Dataset is updated.
                                                                                                  • CV to be used: [CLD-FREQ].
                                                                                                  Example 54: Usage of dcterms:accrualPeriodicity for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:accrualPeriodicity <http://purl.org/cld/terms/annual> .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher":"https://example.com/publisher1",
  "accrualPeriodicity": "annual"
}
                                                                                                  Property: quality measurement
                                                                                                  Property quality measurement
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dqv:hasQualityMeasurement
                                                                                                  Range dqv:QualityMeasurement
                                                                                                  Definition Refers to the performed quality measurements.It represents the evaluation of a given dataset against a specific quality metric
                                                                                                  Usage note Use for quality measurements other than spatial resolution in meters (use dcat:spatialResolutionInMeters). Examples of quality measurements includes completeness, accuracy, accuracy, timeliness, granularity.
                                                                                                  Property: has version
                                                                                                  URI dcat:hasVersion
                                                                                                  Definition: This resource has a more specific, versioned resource [PAV].
                                                                                                  Equivalent property: pav:hasVersion
                                                                                                  Sub-property of: dcterms:hasVersion
                                                                                                  Sub-property of: prov:generalizationOf
                                                                                                  Usage note

                                                                                                  A related Dataset that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the described Dataset.

                                                                                                  Property: inSeries
                                                                                                  Property inSeries
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:inSeries
                                                                                                  Range dcat:DatasetSeries
                                                                                                  Usage note The datasets are linked to the dataset series by using the property dcat:inSeries. Note that a dataset series can also be hierarchical, and a dataset series can be a member of another dataset series
                                                                                                  Definition A dataset series of which the dataset is part.
                                                                                                  Example 55: Usage of dcat:inSeries for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ns#> .
@prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> .
@prefix geonames: <http://www.geonames.org/ontology#> .
@prefix dcat-us: <http://resources.data.gov/ontology/dcat-us#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .

# Define the DatasetSeries
ex:populationCensus a dcat:DatasetSeries ;
  dcterms:title "US Population Census Data"@en ;
  dcterms:description "US Population Census Data from 1950 to 2000"@en ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://www.census.gov/> ;
  dcat-us:geographicBoundingBox [
    a dcat-us:GeographicBoundingBox ;
    dcat-us:westBoundingLongitude -125.0 ;
    dcat-us:eastBoundingLongitude -66.9 ;
    dcat-us:northBoundingLatitude 49.4 ;
    dcat-us:southBoundingLatitude 24.5
  ];
  dcterms:temporal [
    a dcterms:PeriodOfTime ;
    dcterms:start "1950-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
    dcterms:end "2000-12-31"^^xsd:date ;
  ] ;
  dcat:seriesMember ex:populationCensus-1950, ex:populationCensus-1960 ;
  .

# Define individual datasets within the series
ex:populationCensus-1950 a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "US Population Census Data for year 1950"@en ;
  dcterms:description "US Population Census Data for year 1950"@en ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://www.census.gov/> ;
  dcterms:temporal [
    a dcterms:PeriodOfTime ;
    dcterms:start "1940-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
    dcterms:end "1950-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
  ] ;
  dcat:inSeries ex:populationCensus ;
  .

ex:populationCensus-1960 a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "US Population Census Data for year 1960"@en ;
   dcterms:description "US Population Census Data for year 1960"@en ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://www.census.gov/> ;
  dcterms:temporal [
    a dcterms:PeriodOfTime ;
    dcterms:start "1950-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
    dcterms:end "1960-01-01"^^xsd:date ;
  ] ;
  dcat:inSeries ex:populationCensus ;
  .
                                                                                                  Property: is referenced by
                                                                                                  Property is referenced by
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:isReferencedBy
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Resource
                                                                                                  Usage note This property is about a related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to the Dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 56: Usage of dcterms:isReferencedBy for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:publisher <http://example.com/Publisher1> ;
  dcterms:isReferencedBy <https://example.com/dataset2>.


<https://example.com/dataset2>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 2" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset 2" ;
  dcterms:publisher <http://example.com/Publisher2> ;
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@graph": [
    {
      "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
      "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
      "title": "Dataset 1",
      "description": "This is a dataset 1",
      "publisher": "http://example.com/Publisher1",
      "isReferencedBy": "https://example.com/dataset2"
    },
    {
      "@id": "https://example.com/dataset2",
      "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
      "title": "Dataset 2",
      "description": "This is a dataset 2",
      "publisher": "http://example.com/Publisher2"
    }
  ]
}
                                                                                                  Property: language
                                                                                                  Property language
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:language
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:LinguisticSystem
                                                                                                  Definition A language of the dataset. This refers to the natural language used for textual metadata (i.e., titles, descriptions, etc.) of a dataset.
                                                                                                  Usage note Resources defined by the Library of Congress ([ISO 639-1] SHOULD be used.
                                                                                                  Usage note The value(s) provided for members of a catalog (i.e., dataset or service) override the value(s) provided for the catalog if they conflict.
                                                                                                  Usage note If representations of a dataset are available for each language separately, define an instance of dcat:Distribution for each language and describe the specific language of each distribution using dcterms:language (i.e., the dataset will have multiple dcterms:language values and each distribution will have just one as the value of its dcterms:language property). In case of multilingual distributions, the distributions will have multiple dcterms:language values.
                                                                                                  Example 57: Usage of dcterms:language for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:language  <http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1/es>,   # in JSON-LD use only "es" and "en"
                    <http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1/en> .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://census.gov/opendata/1234",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "language": [
    "en",
    "es"
  ]
}
                                                                                                  Property: next
                                                                                                  Property next
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcat:next
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Dataset
                                                                                                  Definition The following resource (after the current one) in an ordered collection or series of resources.
                                                                                                  Property: other identifier
                                                                                                  Property other identifier
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..n
                                                                                                  URI adms:identifier
                                                                                                  Range adms:Identifier
                                                                                                  Usage note A secondary identifier of the Dataset, such as MAST/ADS17, DataCite18, DOI19, EZID20 or W3ID21.
                                                                                                  Example 58: Usage of adms:identifier for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ns#> .
@prefix adms: <http://www.w3.org/ns/adms#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .

ex:Dataset1
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Example Dataset with DOI" ;
  dcterms:description "This dataset provides an example of how to use a DOI as an identifier." ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://doi.gov> ;
    adms:identifier ex:Identifier1 ;
.

ex:Identifier1
  a adms:Identifier ;
  adms:schemaAgency "Department of the Interior";
  skos:notation "10.12345/ex.doi.67890";
  dcat:version "1.0" .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "ex:Dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Example Dataset with DOI",
  "description": "This dataset provides an example of how to use a DOI as an identifier.",
  "publisher": {
    "@id": "https://doi.gov"
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "adms:Identifier",
    "schemaAgency": "Department of the Interior",
    "notation": "10.12345/ex.doi.67890",
    "version": "1.0"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: prev
                                                                                                  Property prev
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcat:prev
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Dataset
                                                                                                  Usage note Unless the dataset is the last in the chain a dataset in a collection must have a previous one.
                                                                                                  Definition The previous resource (before the current one) in an ordered collection or series of resources.
                                                                                                  Property: provenance
                                                                                                  Property provenance
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Optional 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:provenance
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:ProvenanceStatement
                                                                                                  Definition
                                                                                                  • A statement of any changes in ownership and custody of the resource since its creation that are significant for its authenticity, integrity, and interpretation.
                                                                                                  Usage note This property contains a statement about the lineage of a Dataset.
                                                                                                  Example 59: Usage of dcterms:provenance for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .

<http://example.org/datasets/climate-temperature-data> a dcat:Dataset ;
    dcterms:title "Climate Temperature Data: Global Temperature Trends" ;
    dcterms:description "This dataset contains historical temperature measurements used for global climate analysis." ;
    dcterms:publisher <http://example.org/organization/climate-research-institute> ;
    # Custom provenance statement
    dcterms:provenance [
        a dcterms:ProvenanceStatement ;
        rdfs:label "The temperature measurements were collected from weather stations worldwide over the past century."@en
    ].
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "http://example.org/datasets/climate-temperature-data",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Climate Temperature Data: Global Temperature Trends",
  "description": "This dataset contains historical temperature measurements used for global climate analysis.",
  "publisher": "http://example.org/organization/climate-research-institute",
  "provenance": {
    "@type": "dcterms:ProvenanceStatement",
    "labelMap": {
      "en": "The temperature measurements were collected from weather stations worldwide over the past century."
    }
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: qualified attribution
                                                                                                  Property qualified attribution
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI prov:qualifiedAttribution
                                                                                                  Range prov:Attribution
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to a link to an Agent having some form of responsibility for the resource.
                                                                                                  Example 60: Example for dcat:qualifiedAttribution on dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix prov: <http://www.w3.org/ns/prov#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix ex:<http://example.org/> .


<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  prov:qualifiedAttribution [
    a prov:Attribution ;
    prov:agent <https://www.census.gov> ;
    dcat:hadRole <http://resources.data.gov/vocab/isotc211/CI_RoleCode/distributor>
  ] ;
  prov:qualifiedAttribution [
    a prov:Attribution ;
    prov:agent <https://www.doi.gov> ;
    dcat:hadRole <http://resources.data.gov/vocab/isotc211/CI_RoleCode/funder>
  ] ;
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "qualifiedAttribution": [
    {
      "@type": "prov:Attribution",
      "hadRole": "http://resources.data.gov/vocab/isotc211/CI_RoleCode/distributor",
      "agent": "https://www.census.gov"
    },
    {
      "@type": "prov:Attribution",
      "hadRole": "http://resources.data.gov/vocab/isotc211/CI_RoleCode/funder",
      "agent": "https://www.doi.gov"
    }
  ]
}
                                                                                                  Property: qualified relation
                                                                                                  Property qualified relation
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcat:qualifiedRelation
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Relationship
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property provides a link to a description of a relationship with another resource and it is especially meant for relationships between Datasets.
                                                                                                  • It replaces the property rdfs:seeAlso of DCAT-US v1.
                                                                                                  • See here for examples on how to use it: dcat:qualifiedRelation.
                                                                                                  Example 61: Example for dcat:qualifiedRelationship on dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix ex:<http://example.org/ns#> .


<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcat:qualifiedRelation [
    a dcat:Relationship ;
    dcterms:relation <http://example.org/Test543R> ;
    dcat:hadRole <http://registry.it.csiro.au/def/isotc211/DS_AssociationTypeCode/stereoMate>
  ] ;
.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "qualifiedRelation": {
    "@type": "dcat:Relationship",
    "relation": "http://example.org/Test543R",
    "hadRole": "http://registry.it.csiro.au/def/isotc211/DS_AssociationTypeCode/stereoMate"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: related resource
                                                                                                  Property related resource
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:relation
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Resource
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property refers to a related resource where the relationship cannot be further specified as a dcat:qualifiedRelation. This may be additional material such as an article, example or documentation helpful in the context of the Dataset.
                                                                                                  • The element can also be used to link to legal foundations that apply to the publication or usage of the Dataset.
                                                                                                  Property: release date
                                                                                                  Property release date
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..1
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:issued
                                                                                                  Range rdfs:Literal (typed as xsd:date, xsd:dateTime, xsd:gYear or xsd:gYearMonth)
                                                                                                  Usage note
                                                                                                  • This property contains the date of formal issuance (e.g., first publication) of the Dataset.
                                                                                                  • If this date is not known, the date of the first referencing of the data collection in the Catalog can be entered.
                                                                                                  Example 62: Usage of dcterms:issued for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

<https://example.com/dataset1>
  a dcat:Dataset ;
  dcterms:title "Dataset 1" ;
  dcterms:description "This is a dataset" ;
  dcterms:publisher <https://example.com/publisher1> ;
  dcterms:issued "2015-04-26"^^xsd:date .
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "https://example.com/dataset1",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
  "title": "Dataset 1",
  "description": "This is a dataset",
  "publisher": "https://example.com/publisher1",
  "issued": {
    "@type": "xsd:date",
    "@value": "2015-04-26"
  }
}
                                                                                                  Property: rights
                                                                                                  Note
                                                                                                  Changes from DCAT-US 1.1: In transitioning from the DCAT-US 1.1 to the DCAT-US 3.0 Profile, the cardinality of this property has been extended to 0..n
                                                                                                  Property rights
                                                                                                  Requirement level Recommended
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI dcterms:rights
                                                                                                  Range dcterms:RightsStatement
                                                                                                  Usage note This property refers to a statement that specifies copyrights associated with the Dataset.
                                                                                                  Property: sample
                                                                                                  Property sample
                                                                                                  Requirement level Optional
                                                                                                  Cardinality 0..n
                                                                                                  URI adms:sample
                                                                                                  Range dcat:Distribution
                                                                                                  Definition
                                                                                                  • Links to a sample of an Dataset, which is a dcat:Distribution.
                                                                                                  Example 63: Usage of adms:sample for dcat:Dataset 
                                                                                                  @prefix adms: <http://www.w3.org/ns/adms#> .
@prefix dcat: <http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ns#> .
@prefix adms: <http://www.w3.org/ns/adms#> .

# Define the dataset
ex:MyDataset a dcat:Dataset ;
    dcterms:title "My Dataset" ;
    dcterms:description "This is an example dataset." ;
    dcterms:publisher ex:Publisher1;
    adms:sample ex:MySample .

# Define the distribution of the dataset
ex:MyDistribution a dcat:Distribution ;
    dcat:downloadURL <http://example.org/data/mydataset.csv> ;
    dcterms:format <https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/csv>.

# Define the sample of the dataset modeled also as a distribution
ex:MySample a dcat:Distribution ;
    dcterms:title "Sample of My Dataset" ;
    dcterms:description "This is a sample from My Dataset." ;
    dcat:downloadURL <http://example.org/data/mysample.csv> ;
    dcterms:format <https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/csv>.
                                                                                                  {
  "@context": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOI-DO/dcat-us/main/context/dcat-us-3.0.jsonld",
  "@id": "http://example.org/ns#MyDataset",
  "@type": "dcat:Dataset",
